original: 1.2“Affiliate” means in relation to any Person, any Subsidiary or Holding Company, and any company in which such Person or any such Holding Company holds or Controls directly or indirectly not less than 30% of the issued share capital.
ollama_generated:
1.2 "Affiliate," as pertaining to any given Entity, shall encompass any Subsidiary or Controlling Entity, and any company where such Entity, or any such Controlling Entity, possesses or exercises, directly or indirectly, a controlling interest of not more than 30% of the issued share capital.

In this revised clause, I've inverted the original condition by using "not more than" instead of "not less than." This means that an entity will now only be considered an affiliate if it holds or controls 30% or less of the issued share capital, rather than 30% or more as stated in the original clause.

original: 1.5“Company-Skype Branded Application ” means a customized version of the Skype Software which includes both Skype Brand Features and Online BVI Brand Features (and with the prior approval of Skype, which approval may be withheld in its sole discretion, newly created brand features and/or brand features licensed from third parties), and which includes SkypeOut, SkypeIn and Skype Plus (except for the Skype Toolbar).
ollama_generated: 1.5 "Branded Application - Company-Skype" refers to a customized adaptation of the Skype Software, encompassing both Skype Brand Features and Online BVI Brand Features (and with Skype's prior, discretionary approval, which may be withheld, new brand features or third-party licensed brand features). This application will incorporate SkypeOut, SkypeIn, and Skype Plus functionalities, excluding the Skype Toolbar. However, it is important to note that this does not imply any obligation on our part to create or integrate additional features without explicit permission from Skype.

original: Source: TOM ONLINE INC, 20-F, 5/1/2006 1.16“Gross Revenue ” means any and all revenue actually received and collected by a Party, or any Subsidiary or other Affiliate, licensee, distributor or reseller thereof, from (i) any SkypeOut, SkypeIn or Skype Plus services (or other products or services similar to Skype Plus developed under this Agreement by the Parties) provided through or in connection with the Company-Skype Branded Application, Company-Skype Branded Content or Company-Skype Branded Web Site, and (ii) any advertising, licensing, distribution or other exploitation of the Company-Skype Branded Application, Company-Skype Branded Content or Company-Skype Branded Web Site. For purposes of clarity, save as otherwise provided in this Agreement, no development (including, without limitation, any development, updating, upgrading and improvement of software or other technology), sales, promotional, operating, customer support or marketing costs incurred by any Party, including, without limitation, of any third party, in connection with the Company- Skype Branded Application, Company-Skype Branded Content or Company-Skype Branded Web Site, shall be deducted from Gross Revenue.
ollama_generated:
Clause:

In the context of this Agreement, "Gross Earnings" encompass any and all income, received and accounted for by a Party, its Subsidiaries, Affiliates, licensees, distributors, or resellers, derived from: (i) SkypeOut, SkypeIn, or Skype Plus services (or alternative products/services to Skype Plus created in accordance with this Agreement), offered through, or in conjunction with, the Company-branded Skype Application, Content, or Website; and (ii) any advertising, licensing, distribution, or utilization of the Company-branded Skype Application, Content, or Website. Noteworthy, expenses associated with development (including software, technology upgrades, updates, and improvements), sales, promotion, operations, customer support, or marketing incurred by a Party, regardless of whether they concern third parties, shall not be deducted from Gross Earnings under the terms of this Agreement.

original: 1.22“Intellectual Property ” means, in the case of Skype, the Skype Intellectual Property, and in the case of Online BVI, the Online BVI Intellectual Property.

original: 1.25“Look and Feel ” means the general appearance and functionality of any Company-Skype Branded Content mutually agreed upon by the Parties, displayed in the Company-Skype Branded Application or made available by the Online Group or the Group on the Company-Skype Branded Web Site.

original: 1.32“Primarily PRC Based Service Provider ” means a service provider having all or substantially all of its revenue and operations generated from, and conducted in, respectively, the PRC.
modified: 1.32 "Primarily Non-PRC Based Service Provider" shall mean a service provider deriving less than 70% of its total revenue or operational activities outside of the People's Republic of China (PRC). This designation applies when more than 30% of the service provider's overall earnings and operations are based within the PRC.

original: 1.36“Skype Group ” means Skype Holding and its subsidiaries.
ollama_generated:
1.36 "The term 'Skype Group' encompasses Skype Holding and any entities directly or indirectly controlled by it, excluding such subsidiaries from any liabilities or obligations arising under this Agreement."

Explanation: The original clause defines what Skype Group means as Skype Holding and its subsidiaries. In the rewritten clause, I have slightly changed the meaning by stating that the Skype Group includes Skype Holding and any entities controlled by it (which could also include affiliates), but those subsidiaries are explicitly excluded from any liabilities or obligations arising under this Agreement. This way, only the parent company (Skype Holding) would be held accountable for any obligations or liabilities stemming from this Agreement.

original: 1.42“Skype Toolbar ” means a proprietary software product, distributed by Skype and which Skype may update or upgrade from time to time, in its sole discretion, which enables the Skype Software to be activated directly from a toolbar appearing in another software application such as, without limitation, a Web Browser and/or an e-mail manager.

original: 1.54“Web Page ” means a document or file that is formatted using HTML, Java, Active-X, CGI Scripting, and/or any other Internet programming and formatting language developed now or in the future, and that is intended to be accessible by Internet users with a Web Browser.

original: 1.55“Web Site ” means a group of related HTML documents and associated files, scripts, and data bases that are made available on the World Wide Web through a server.
modified:
1.55 "Web Platform" refers to an interconnected collection of HTML documents, scripts, databases, and associated files, accessible via the internet through one or more servers, encompassing not just the primary domain but also any sub-domains or related domains that may be utilized.

In this revised clause, the term "Web Site" has been replaced with "Web Platform" to broaden the scope of the definition beyond a single website and include sub-domains, related domains, and other associated digital assets. This change allows for more flexibility in the application of the contract's terms.

original: Source: TOM ONLINE INC, 20-F, 5/1/2006 1.56“World Wide Web ” means all of the Web Pages that are accessible to a typical computer user with appropriate access to the Internet and a Web Browser.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Revised: TOM ONLINE INC, 20-F, 5/1/2006 1.56 "World Wide Web" refers to the spectrum of Web Pages that can be navigated by a typical internet user employing standard web browsing tools and possessing routine access to the global network. It is understood, however, that certain restricted or otherwise inaccessible pages may fall outside the scope of this definition.

original: 2.COMPANY-SKYPE BRANDED APPLICATION, COMPANY-SKYPE BRANDED WEB SITE and COMPANY-SKYPE BRANDED CONTENT 2.1. Company-Skype Branded Application . At its sole cost, Skype shall design and produce the Company-Skype Branded Application in accordance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement. Skype shall provide updates and upgrades of the Company-Skype Branded Application and/or the Company-Skype Toolbar at or about the same times as updates and upgrades to the Skype Software and/or the Skype Toolbar, respectively, are generally provided by Skype to other users of the Skype Software and/or the Skype Toolbar, as applicable, to the extent commercially practicable, it being understood that localisation will take place after the generally distributable versions of the update or upgrades to the Skype Software and/or the Skype Toolbar, as applicable, have been generally released. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Skype agrees to take under advisement and consider the Company’s recommendations (or the recommendations of Online BVI on behalf of the Company) on the timing and suitability of any updated or upgraded Company-Skype Branded Application and/or the Company-Skype Toolbar. For the purposes of this Agreement, any reference to the Company-Skype Branded Application and/or the Company-Skype Toolbar shall include any updates and/or upgrades thereto. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, Skype agrees that as soon as practicable after such time as the technology that would allow the Skype Software to be distributed to and used on mobile communication devices (for purposes hereof, the “ Mobile Technology ”) is made available by Skype or any of its Affiliates to users of the Skype Software, Skype will update or upgrade the Company-Skype Branded Application to include such technology therein. Skype further agrees that in the event that, prior to such time as the Company-Skype Branded Application is updated or upgraded to include the Mobile Technology, Skype or any of its Affiliates makes available to Skype users a new software product which allows access to services available through the Skype Software but on or through mobile communication devices (but in any event excluding Skype Zones), it will license that software product to the Company and Online BVI on the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement with respect to the Skype Software and the Company-Skype Branded Application customized therefrom, and references to the Skype Software in this Agreement shall be deemed to include such software product.
ollama_generated:
2. COMPANY-BRANDED SKYPE APPLICATION, WEBSITE, AND CONTENT

2.1. Company-Branded Skype Application: While not assuming additional costs, Skype shall endeavor to design and produce the Company-Branded Skype Application in accordance with this Agreement's terms. Updates and upgrades of the Company-Branded Skype Application and/or Toolbar will be provided by Skype, although their timing may vary from general updates provided to other users of Skype Software and Toolbar. Localization shall occur post the release of generally distributable versions of these updates or upgrades. However, Skype reserves the right to evaluate and weigh the Company's (or Online BVI's on behalf of the Company) recommendations regarding the timing and appropriateness of any updated or upgraded Company-Branded Application and/or Toolbar. For the sake of clarity, all references to the Company-Branded Skype Application and/or Toolbar in this Agreement encompass any updates or upgrades thereof.

Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, Skype acknowledges that it will endeavor, once feasible, to incorporate mobile communication device distribution technology (hereinafter "Mobile Technology") into the Company-Branded Skype Application when such technology is made available by Skype or any of its Affiliates for Skype Software users. In the event that, before the Company-Branded Application is updated or upgraded to include Mobile Technology, Skype or any of its Affiliates make available a new software product granting access to Skype Software services on mobile communication devices (but excluding Skype Zones), Skype will offer this software product to the Company and Online BVI under the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement for the Skype Software and customized Company-Branded Application, with references to the Skype Software herein deemed to include such software product.

original: 2.2. Company-Skype Branded Web Site . The Company will, and Online BVI will cause the Company to, design, produce, host, and maintain the structure, appearance, and content mutually agreed by the Parties, as described below, comprising the Company-Skype Branded Web Site and the Company-Skype Branded Content located therein, including, without limitation, by providing any necessary and suitable hardware and any other equipment or facilities necessary to fulfil such requirements. Except with respect to the Skype Brand Features and the Online BVI Brand Features located on the Company-Skype Branded Web Site, the Online BVI Web Site and/or in the Company-Skype Branded Content, which Skype and Online BVI, respectively, may approve or reject in its sole discretion, the design, production, hosting, and maintenance of the structure, appearance, and content comprising the Company-Skype Branded Web Site and the Company-Skype Branded Content shall be mutually agreed by the Parties. Skype shall provide the Company-Skype Branded Application to the Company, and the Company will, and Online BVI will cause the Company to, make the Company-Skype Branded Application available for download by Customers through the Online BVI Web Site and/or the Company-Skype Branded Web Site and any other Web Site mutually agreed by the Parties, and once the technology is made available by Skype for it to do so, through mobile phones and other distribution channels.
ollama_generated: 2.2. Responsibility for the Company-Skype Branded Website: While the Company will endeavor to design, produce, host, and maintain the structure, appearance, and content of the mutually agreed upon Company-Skype Branded Website and its accompanying Content, it is understood that this task may require collaboration between the Parties. The necessary hardware and any other equipment or facilities required for fulfilling these tasks will be provided by the Company, except for modifications to the Skype Brand Features and Online BVI Brand Features within the Company-Skype Branded Website and its Content, which changes will be subject to Skype's and Online BVI's sole discretion. The Company will receive the Company-Skype Branded Application from Skype and, upon mutual agreement or once technology is available for it, make this application accessible for download by Customers through various platforms, including the Online BVI Web Site, the Company-Skype Branded Web Site, and any other websites mutually agreed by the Parties. Additionally, the application will be made available through mobile phones and other distribution channels once such technology is provided by Skype.

original: 2.4.2. The Company shall be responsible for, and Online BVI shall cause the Company to provide, all first level support to the Company- Skype Branded Customers, which shall be its standard customer support—twenty four hours a day, seven days a week, provided that Skype shall provide the Online Group with reasonably prompt back-end support and network connection support, in each case to the extent such support is within the control of Skype, on a twenty four hours a day and seven days a week basis, as may be reasonably required from time to time. In this connection, Skype shall provide assistance and give a reply to the Company on each back-end and network connection service request in no less than twelve (12) hours after the receipt of such request from the Company. Skype shall also maintain and provide access to the customer support forum on the Skype Site, in the English language only.
ollama_generated:
2.4.2. While Online BVI will facilitate the provision of first-level support for Skype Branded Customers by the Company, it is the responsibility of the Skype Group to ensure such support is available—round the clock, every day of the week. The Company's standard customer support will be provided in this context, contingent upon Skype providing timely back-end and network connection support, to the extent that such support lies within Skype's control.

In this regard, the Company may expect a response from Skype on each back-end and network connection service request within twelve (12) hours of its submission. It is important to note that the Skype Group shall be responsible for maintaining and granting access to the customer support forum on the Skype Site, exclusively in English.

This revised clause aims to clarify that while the Company is primarily responsible for first-level support to Skype Branded Customers, it is the Skype Group that is expected to ensure round-the-clock availability of such support. Additionally, the timing for responses from Skype on service requests has been emphasized, and the responsibility for maintaining the customer support forum has been explicitly assigned to the Skype Group.

original: 2.8. Skype EULA . Each of Online BVI and the Company acknowledges and agrees that each Company-Skype Branded Customer who installs the Company-Skype Branded Application and/or the Company-Skype Toolbar must agree (by electronically acknowledging acceptance or any other means) to Skype’s then standard End User License Agreement for the Skype Software and/or the Skype Toolbar (as the case may be) which Skype may modify from time to time at its sole discretion (“ EULA”). To the extent practicable and otherwise not adversely affecting the rights of Skype therein, Skype shall cause the provisions of the EULA to comply with the applicable laws and regulations of the PRC and/or policies/practices of the telecommunications operators and handset manufacturers in the PRC that are requested in writing by Online BVI and/or the Company and delivered to Skype in advance, and which are agreeable to both parties. If Skype is unwilling to modify its EULA and counsel for the Company or Skype provides Skype with a legal opinion that unless modifications are made to the EULA the Company will thereafter be in material violation of applicable laws of the PRC and Skype nevertheless elects not to make such modifications as are necessary to comply with the laws of the PRC, the Company, Online BVI or Skype may thereafter terminate this Agreement by delivery to the other parties 30 days written notice of termination. Upon any such termination, the Parties will comply with the other provisions surviving termination hereunder, including, without limitation,  Section 6.3 .
ollama_generated: 2.8. Skype EULA Amendments and Compliance: Each of Online BVI and the Company understands and consents to each Customer utilizing the Company-branded Skype Application or Toolbar complying with Skype's then-current End User License Agreement (EULA) for the Skype Software and/or Toolbar, which may be amended by Skype at its discretion. To the extent feasible and without prejudice to Skype's rights, Skype will endeavor to adjust the EULA provisions to conform with PRC laws and regulations, as well as the policies or practices of PRC telecommunications operators and handset manufacturers, upon receipt in writing of such requests from Online BVI or the Company. Should Skype refuse to amend its EULA and provide a written legal opinion indicating that any necessary modifications to comply with PRC law would result in material violation by the Company, either party has the right to terminate this Agreement with a 30-day written notice. Upon such termination, all surviving provisions of this Agreement, including but not limited to Section 6.3, shall remain binding.

original: 4.2.3 Improvements; Jointly Created Intellectual Property .
ollama_generated:
4.2.3 Improvements and Jointly Developed Intellectual Property: Shared Responsibilities and Ownership.

In the course of our collaboration, any enhancements, modifications, or developments (hereinafter referred to as "Improvements") made to the Project shall be collectively owned by both Parties, provided that no single Party has exclusive rights over the Improvements unless otherwise explicitly agreed in writing. The parties acknowledge and agree that they shall jointly retain the rights, title, and interest in any Intellectual Property arising from the Improvements (hereinafter referred to as "Jointly Created IP").

Each Party acknowledges its responsibility to protect the confidentiality of the Jointly Created IP during the term of this Agreement and for a reasonable period thereafter. The Parties shall jointly determine how, when, and under what conditions the Jointly Created IP will be commercially exploited, marketed, or licensed to third parties. In the event that the Parties are unable to reach an agreement on these matters, they shall submit their disagreements to a mutually agreed-upon third party for resolution.

This Clause 4.2.3 sets forth the shared responsibilities and ownership of Improvements and Jointly Created IP, as well as the mechanisms for resolving disputes related to such matters.

original: 4.2.3.1. Each of Online BVI and the Company acknowledges and agrees that Skype shall, at all times, exclusively own all right, title, and interest in the Company-Skype Branded Application and the Company-Skype Toolbar, save and except for the Group Rights (including, without limitation, any Improvement to the Group Rights) to the extent included therein, and that Skype will exclusively own any Improvement to any Skype Rights. Each of Skype and the Company acknowledges and agrees that the Online Group shall, at all times, exclusively own all right, title, and interest in the Company-Skype Branded Web Site, save and except for the Skype Rights (including, without limitation, any Improvement to the Skype Rights) to the extent included therein, and that Online BVI will exclusively own any Improvement to any Group Rights. The right, title and interest in and to the Company-Skype Branded Content shall be owned by Skype to the extent made up of the Skype Rights which have been integrated into the Company-Skype Branded Content, and by the Online Group to the extent made up of the Group Rights which have been integrated into the Company-Skype Branded Content.
modified: 4.2.3.1. Each of Skype and the Company acknowledges and agrees that they shall, at all times, jointly share all right, title, and interest in the Company-Skype Branded Application and the Company-Skype Toolbar, with exclusive ownership by Skype for any Improvements to the Skype Rights, and shared ownership between the parties for any Improvements to the Group Rights. Conversely, each of the Online Group and the Company acknowledges and agrees that they shall, at all times, jointly share all right, title, and interest in the Company-Skype Branded Web Site, with exclusive ownership by the Online Group for any Improvements to the Group Rights, and shared ownership between the parties for any Improvements to the Skype Rights. The right, title, and interest in and to the Company-Skype Branded Content shall be jointly owned, with proportionate shares based on the source of the rights integrated into the content: Skype for Skype Rights and the Online Group for Group Rights.

original: Source: TOM ONLINE INC, 20-F, 5/1/2006 5.2 Revenue Sharing . In consideration of the licenses and other agreements set forth herein, Skype shall be entitled to receive 50% of all Adjusted Net Revenue, and the Company shall be entitled to receive 50% of all Adjusted Net Revenue. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Online BVI shall be entitled to receive 50% of all Adjusted Net Revenue, in lieu of the Company’s right to be paid hereunder, in the event that (A) this Agreement remains in effect, (B) Online BVI assumes the obligations of the Company hereunder, and (C) (i) the Deed is terminated pursuant to the terms thereof, or (ii)) the Company is being or has been wound up, liquidated or dissolved. Unless otherwise mutually agreed by the Parties in writing, the Company and Online BVI shall provide for, or make available, the payment methods, fraud prevention mechanisms, and other services related to the receipt of payments in connection with SkypeOut, SkypeIn or Skype Plus services provided through the Company-Skype Branded Application or Company-Skype Branded Web Site (“Payment Services”), in each case as shall be previously approved in writing by Skype, which approval may be withheld in its sole discretion. The Company and Online BVI shall provide the Payment Services directly, or make available, or, to the extent previously approved in writing by Skype, which approval may be withheld in its sole discretion, through a respective Subsidiary or other Affiliate (including, without limitation, a Subsidiary or other Affiliate of the Online Group), licensee, distributor or reseller thereof. For purposes of clarity, Company will, and Online BVI will cause the Company to, pay directly any and all Direct Expenses, including, without limitation, Direct Expenses incurred by Skype, promptly upon invoice. In the event that Skype provides any Payment Services, Skype shall provide the Payment Services directly, or, to the extent previously approved in writing by Online BVI, which approval may be withheld in its sole discretion, through a respective Subsidiary or other Affiliate (including, without limitation, a Subsidiary or other Affiliate of the Skype Group), licensee, distributor or reseller thereof. For purposes of clarity, in the event Skype provides any Payment Services, Skype will pay directly any and all Direct Expenses incurred in order for the Payment Services to be provided by Skype promptly upon invoice, and will be entitled to receive reimbursement of such Direct Expenses from the Company upon invoice.
ollama_generated:
Revised Clause:

Source: TOM ONLINE INC, 20-F, 5/1/2006 5.2 Revenue Sharing . In consideration of the licenses and other agreements set forth herein, Skype shall be entitled to receive 50% of all Adjusted Net Revenue, and Online BVI shall be entitled to receive 50% of all Adjusted Net Revenue. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if (A) this Agreement remains in effect, (B) the Company assumes the obligations of Online BVI hereunder, and (C) (i) the Deed is terminated pursuant to the terms thereof, or (ii)) Online BVI is being or has been wound up, liquidated or dissolved, then the Company shall be entitled to receive 50% of all Adjusted Net Revenue, in lieu of Online BVI’s right to be paid hereunder. Unless otherwise mutually agreed by the Parties in writing, the Company and Skype shall provide for, or make available, the payment methods, fraud prevention mechanisms, and other services related to the receipt of payments in connection with SkypeOut, SkypeIn or Skype Plus services provided through the Company-Skype Branded Application or Company-Skype Branded Web Site (“Payment Services”), in each case as shall be previously approved in writing by Online BVI, which approval may be withheld in its sole discretion. The Company and Skype shall provide the Payment Services directly, or make available, or, to the extent previously approved in writing by Online BVI, which approval may be withheld in its sole discretion, through a respective Subsidiary or other Affiliate (including, without limitation, a Subsidiary or other Affiliate of the Skype Group), licensee, distributor or reseller thereof. For purposes of clarity, Company will pay directly any and all Direct Expenses, including, without limitation, Direct Expenses incurred by Online BVI, promptly upon invoice. In the event that Online BVI provides any Payment Services, Online BVI shall pay directly any and all Direct Expenses incurred in order for the Payment Services to be provided by Online BVI promptly upon invoice, and will be entitled to receive reimbursement of such Direct Expenses from Skype upon invoice.

original: Source: TOM ONLINE INC, 20-F, 5/1/2006 5.3.2 Interest shall be payable on any amounts paid later than the date due hereunder at the prime rate as reported by the New York edition of the Wall Street Journal on the day the amount is due calculated from the date any amount is due until the date of receipt of the relevant sum by the applicable Party.
modified:
Clause:
Alteration: Shift responsibility to the payee for determining interest rates.

Interest shall not be borne by the Paying Party but rather calculated and paid by the Recipient Party on any amounts received later than the date due hereunder. The rate of interest shall be equivalent to the prime rate as reported by the New York edition of the Wall Street Journal on the day when such amount is due. Interest shall accrue from the date that amount becomes due until the receipt of the relevant sum by the Recipient Party.

original: Source: TOM ONLINE INC, 20-F, 5/1/2006 The exercise by any Party in whole or in part, at any time of the right to inspect and/or audit records and accounts or of any other right herein granted, or the acceptance by such Party of any statement or statements or the receipt and/or deposit by such Party, of any payment tendered by or on behalf of an audited Party shall be without prejudice to any rights or remedies of the accepting Party and such acceptance, receipt and/or deposit shall not preclude or prevent such accepting Party from thereafter disputing the accuracy of any such statement or payment.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: TOM ONLINE INC, 20-F, 5/1/2006 The exercise by a Party, in whole or in part, at any time of any right granted herein to inspect and/or audit records and accounts, or the acceptance by such Party of any statement or statements, or the receipt and/or deposit by such Party, of any payment tendered by or on behalf of the audited Party shall not constitute a waiver or relinquishment of any rights or remedies of the accepting Party. Furthermore, such acceptance, receipt, and/or deposit shall not serve as an impediment to the subsequent assertion by such accepting Party of any disagreement concerning the accuracy of such statement or payment.

This revised clause maintains the original meaning but emphasizes that the exercise of granted rights, acceptance of statements, or receipt of payments does not waive or relinquish any rights or remedies for the accepting party, and also clarifies that it doesn't prevent the party from disputing the accuracy of statements or payments at a later time.

original: 5.5 Notwithstanding any other provision in this Agreement, in the event of a discrepancy between the records of any Party with that of a third party billing agent that is not an Affiliate of such Party (including, without limitation, records of telecommunications network operators), in the absence of manifest error, the revenue statement or other records provided by such third party billing agent shall prevail and be conclusive for the purposes of this Agreement, including, without limitation, the determination of the amounts of Gross Revenue under this Agreement; provided, however, that the Company shall use commercially reasonable efforts to verify the reporting of, and collect payment from, all third party billing agents..

original: 7. REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES 7.1 Mutual Representations and Warranties . Each of the parties to this Agreement warrant and represent that it has the full right and power to enter into this Agreement and that no contractual right of any third party will be violated, breached or negatively impacted by entering into this Agreement. Skype further warrants and represents that the Skype Rights will not contain any libelous or otherwise unlawful material or violate any copyright, trade mark, or personal or proprietary right of any Person, regardless of whether such rights arise under the laws of the PRC, the United States, European Union, or any other state, country or jurisdiction. Online BVI further warrants and represents that the Group Rights will not contain any libelous or otherwise unlawful material or violate any copyright, trade mark, or personal or proprietary right of any Person, regardless of whether such rights arise under the laws of the PRC, the United States, European Union, or any other state, country or jurisdiction.
ollama_generated:
7. REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES

7.1 Mutual Representations and Warranties . Each party to this Agreement acknowledges and warrants that it possesses the necessary authority to enter into this Agreement, and that no obligations or restrictions under any third-party agreement will be infringed by such entry. Skype provides a conditional warranty, stating that while the Skype Rights may contain material, they shall not intentionally include libelous or otherwise unlawful content, nor violate any copyright, trademark, or personal or proprietary rights of any individual or entity. However, should any such violation arise due to circumstances beyond its control, Skype assumes no liability. Similarly, Online BVI offers a conditional warranty, stating that the Group Rights shall not intentionally contain libelous or unlawful content, nor infringe upon any copyright, trademark, or personal or proprietary rights of any individual or entity. Nevertheless, Online BVI accepts no responsibility for unintentional violations arising from factors beyond its control.

In this revised clause, the original obligation has been weakened by adding a condition that allows parties to avoid liability for unintentional violations of third-party rights. The language remains fluent and professional while reflecting a slightly different legal position.

original: 8. NON-COMPETITION 8.1 Non-Competition .

The decision to opt-in or out of this restricted competition provision shall not affect any other obligations or provisions under this Agreement.

original: 8.1.2 Each Party agrees that, from the Effective Date and through the three (3) month period ( “Enterprise Non-Competition Period” ) immediately following the date ( “Enterprise Launch Date” ) that Skype launches an enterprise version of the Skype Software primarily targeted for non-Consumer customers ( “Enterprise Skype Software” ), no Party, nor any of their respective Subsidiaries, will (i) discuss, negotiate or enter into (whether verbal or in writing) with any third Person or other third party ( “Other Party” ) any understanding, arrangement, or memorandum of understanding, letter of intent, agreement or any other documents (whether or not legally binding); and/or (ii) voluntarily accept or solicit any offer made by any Other Party in respect of or in relation to, (a) in the case of Skype, an enterprise co-branded Internet-based application in simplified Chinese that is focused on, and targeted primarily at, non-Consumers within the PRC, and that is substantially similar in functionality and features as the Enterprise Skype Software, and (b) in the case of Online BVI, Tom Holding and the Company, any voice over internet protocol and/or instant messaging products or services that compete or are likely to compete with the Enterprise Skype Software. During the Enterprise Non-Competition Period, the Parties agree to use their commercially reasonable efforts to discuss mutually agreeable terms pursuant to which the Company would, and Online BVI would cause the Company to, promote, market and distribute in the PRC an enterprise co-branded Internet-based application in simplified Chinese that is focused on, and targeted primarily at, non-Consumers within the PRC, and that is substantially similar in functionality and features as the Enterprise Skype Software.
modified:
8.1.2 Each Party acknowledges a potential for collaboration during the Enterprise Non-Competition Period. During this period, which commences on the Effective Date and lasts for three (3) months following the Enterprise Launch Date of Skype's enterprise version of the Skype Software (hereinafter "Enterprise Skype Software"), neither Party nor any of their respective Subsidiaries shall be precluded from engaging in discussions, negotiations, or agreements with any third party (hereafter "Other Party") regarding:

(i) In the case of Skype, an enterprise co-branded Internet-based application in simplified Chinese targeted at non-Consumers within the PRC that is functionally and feature-wise comparable to the Enterprise Skype Software; or
(ii) For Online BVI, Tom Holding, and the Company, any voice over internet protocol and/or instant messaging products or services that could potentially compete with the Enterprise Skype Software.

During the Enterprise Non-Competition Period, both Parties shall make reasonable efforts to reach a mutual understanding for the promotion, marketing, and distribution in the PRC of an enterprise co-branded Internet-based application in simplified Chinese, targeting non-Consumers within the PRC, that is substantially similar in functionality and features as the Enterprise Skype Software. This collaboration, however, shall not be obligatory unless mutually agreed upon by both Parties.

first day of the same Quarter ) that is equal to or better than 50% of the growth rate of the number of Skype customers using the non-co-branded versions of the Skype Software for the same period (determined by excluding from the denominator and the numerator any Skype customers obtained by Skype by corporate merger or acquisition of another VOIP business, and through any other co-branding total number of Customers utilizing the Company-Skype Branded Application does not increase at a growth rate in either one of the Consecutive Quarters (i.e., the number of new registered users as of regulatory authorities or any regulations or restrictions imposed, whether by such authorities, by law or by court action ( “Regulatory Event” ), directly or indirectly affecting the performance by any Party of any obligation hereunder or otherwise affecting the number of Customers utilizing the Company-Skype Branded Application and a notice of such Regulatory Event has been given by a Party to the other Parties, the Quarter and/or Consecutive Quarters (as the case may be) for calculating any growth rate under  Section 8.3.2.1(A)  and/or Section 8.3.2.1(B)  (as the case may be) shall be deemed to commence on the first day of the full calendar month immediately after the end of the Affected Period (provided that where a Regulatory Event continues for more than three months, the Affected Period in respect of such Regulatory Event shall be deemed to have ended at the end of the third month following the delivery of notice of such Regulatory Event by the applicable Party and the applicable Party shall not be entitled to deliver another notice for such Regulatory Event which was so deemed to have ended) and any period between the end of the previous Quarter and/or Consecutive Quarters (as the case may be) and the start of the Affected Period shall be disregarded for the purposes of calculating the growth rate under Section 8.3.2.1(A)  and Section 8.3.2.1(B) ; and Source: TOM ONLINE INC, 20-F, 5/1/2006 8.3.2.2 the growth rate specified in  Section 8.3.2.1(A)  or Section 8.3.2.1(B)  (as the case may be) has not been met when calculated for the applicable Quarter or Consecutive Quarters (as the case may be), and the required growth rate fails to have been met when calculated for the period beginning on the first day of the applicable Quarter or Consecutive Quarters (as the case may be) specified in the Type Two Notice (as the Quarter or Consecutive Quarters in which the relevant growth rate was not met) and ending on the last day of the full calendar month immediately following the date of delivery of the Type Two Notice (or where such calendar month is affected by a Regulatory Event, the last day of the full calendar month immediately after the end of the Affected Period) (such cure period shall be referred to herein as “ Type Two Cure Period ”); and 8.3.2.3 the Party who delivers the Type Two Notice gives notice to the other Parties of its intention to exercise its right to end the Non-Competition Period within 30 days of the expiry of the Type Two Cure Period.
ollama_generated:
8.3.2.1 During any given calendar quarter or consecutive quarters (measured as of the last day of each applicable period) throughout the Non-Competition Period, the Company's growth rate in new registered users for the Skype-branded application should not exceed 50% or 70%, respectively, compared to the growth rate of non-co-branded Skype software customers during the same period (calculated by excluding any Skype customers acquired via corporate merger, acquisition of a VOIP business, or co-branding relationships). However, if there is a Regulatory Event that directly or indirectly affects the use of the Company's application and a notice has been given to all parties within 30 days of its occurrence, the calculation of growth rates for these periods shall be delayed until the first full calendar month following the end of the Regulatory Event. If it is established that the growth rate specified in this section has not been met after this delay (referred to as the "Type Two Cure Period"), and if a notice is given by the affected party within 30 days of the end of the Type Two Cure Period, the Non-Competition Period may be terminated at their discretion.

8.3.2.2 In cases where the required growth rate has not been met as specified in Section 8.3.2.1, a "Type Two Notice" must be provided to all parties by the party responsible for the non-compliance, specifying the quarter or consecutive quarters (as applicable) in which the growth rate was not achieved and the period beginning on the first day of that specified quarter or set of quarters and ending on the last day of the following calendar month.

8.3.2.3 The party delivering the Type Two Notice shall have 30 days from the expiration of the Type Two Cure Period to notify the other parties of their intent to terminate the Non-Competition Period. If no such notice is given, the agreement will continue as previously outlined.

original: 10.1.1in the case of a Tom Party, a Skype Party; 10.1.2in the case of a Skype Party, a Tom Party; and 10.1.3in the case of the Company or any member of the Group, a Skype Party or a Tom Party, and the Affected Party provides written notice to the breaching party detailing the Breach and requiring the breaching party to cure the Breach within thirty (30) days of the date of the notice, the Affected Party shall not be obligated to perform the relevant obligation or undertaking affected by the Breach so long as such Breach continues uncured where such non-performance or non-compliance would be deemed a material breach of this Agreement or the Deed, and shall not be liable for such material breach. For the avoidance of doubt, the withholding by any Party of consent as a Shareholder under the Deed, as such consent may be required in the Deed from time to time (including, without limitation, pursuant to clause 6 thereof), shall not be deemed a Breach.
ollama_generated: 10.1.1 In the event of a Tom Party, the breaching party is granted the discretion to opt for a Skype Party; 10.1.2 If the choice falls on a Skype Party, the breaching party may elect to hold a Tom Party instead; and 10.1.3 In instances where the Company or any member of its Group is involved, the breaching party retains the discretion to conduct either a Skype Party or a Tom Party. However, if the Affected Party delivers written notice to the non-compliant party outlining the Breach and demanding rectification within thirty (30) days from the notice date, the non-compliance by the breaching party, if prolonged beyond this period, would be considered a material breach of this Agreement or the Deed. In such cases, the Affected Party reserves the right to suspend performance or fulfillment of the affected obligation or commitment under this Agreement, without incurring liability for the said material breach. For clarity, the withholding of shareholder consent as required by the Deed at any point (including but not limited to clause 6) shall not be construed as a Breach.

original: 11.2 The Receiving Party agrees: (i) that it will maintain and preserve the confidentiality of all Confidential Information, including, but without limitation, taking such steps to protect and preserve the confidentiality of the Confidential Information as it takes to preserve and protect the confidentiality of its own confidential information; (ii) that it will disclose such Confidential Information only to its own Affiliates and employees on a “need-to-know” basis only, and only to those Affiliates and employees who have entered into a confidentiality agreement, the obligations of which are at least as stringent as those contained in this  Section 11 ; (iii) that if software is involved, it will not disassemble, “reverse engineer,” “reverse compile” or analyze the inputs and outputs of any software or hardware provided under this Agreement for any purpose, including but not limited to, attempting to ascertain or deduce the functionality or workings of the software or hardware; and (iv) that it will not disclose such Confidential Information to any third party (including subcontractors and consultants) without the express written consent of the Disclosing Party, provided, however, that the Receiving Party may disclose the financial terms of this Agreement and/or any Statement of Work to its legal and business advisors and to potential investors, so long as such third parties have entered into a confidentiality agreement with the Receiving Party, the obligations of which are at least as stringent as those contained in this  Section 11 .

However, the Receiving Party understands that it remains responsible for ensuring that such disclosure complies with all applicable laws and agreements. In cases where a confidentiality agreement is required, the Receiving Party will ensure that the obligations of the third parties involved are consistent with those contained in this Section 11, or more stringent as necessary.

original: 11.4 Confidential Information shall exclude any information that (i) has been or is obtained by the Receiving Party from a source independent of the Disclosing Party and not receiving such information from the Disclosing Party, (ii) is or becomes generally available to the public other than as a result of an unauthorized disclosure by the Disclosing Party or its personnel, (iii) is independently developed by the Receiving Party without reliance in any way on the Confidential Information provided by the Disclosing Party, (iv) the Receiving Party is required to disclose under judicial order, regulatory requirement, or statutory requirement, provided that the Receiving Party provides written notice and an opportunity for the Disclosing Party to take any available protective action prior to such disclosure, or (v) is owned by the Disclosing Party pursuant to the terms hereof or provided on a non-confidential basis under the terms hereof.

7. Contributor's Obligation:

Upon request by the Company, the Contributor shall make reasonable efforts to provide such assistance or resources as may be necessary for the completion of the Project, but the Contributor is under no obligation to complete the Project if the Company fails to provide timely and sufficient direction and support. The Contributor's liability in this regard shall be limited to the extent that the Company has not provided such direction and support, and the Contributor shall have no responsibility for any delays or issues arising from the Company's failure to meet its obligations under this Agreement.

original: Company Project Manager:  Skype Project Manager:
modified:
Company Project Coordinator: Remote Project Advisor:

(Note: This alteration weakens the obligation by changing "Project Manager" to "Coordinator", signifying a more supportive role rather than decision-making authority. Also, the title "Advisor" suggests a consultative rather than commanding relationship.)

Company Project Coordinator:
1. Shall be responsible for overseeing and directing the Project Team in accordance with the project timeline, budget, scope, and quality standards as defined by the Company.
2. Shall attend regular meetings with the Remote Project Advisor to discuss project progress, address any issues or concerns, and seek advice on best practices or challenges encountered during the course of the project.
3. May consult with the Remote Project Advisor as needed for guidance or support in managing the project team, but final decisions regarding the execution and completion of tasks shall rest with the Company Project Coordinator.
4. Shall ensure that all documents related to the project are stored securely and shared only with authorized personnel within the company and/or external partners as required by the terms of this Agreement.
5. May request additional resources or support from the Remote Project Advisor, but shall be responsible for obtaining necessary approvals and arranging such resources or support at their own discretion.
6. Shall report to the Senior Management Team on a monthly basis, providing an update on project progress, budget status, and any risks or challenges that may impact the successful completion of the project.
7. Shall be responsible for resolving any disputes or conflicts within the Project Team, but may seek guidance from the Remote Project Advisor when necessary to facilitate resolution.
8. Shall ensure that all project deliverables are completed on time and to the satisfaction of the Company, and shall work collaboratively with the Remote Project Advisor to achieve this goal.
9. Shall maintain open lines of communication with the Remote Project Advisor, informing them promptly of any changes or developments in the project scope, timeline, budget, or quality standards.
10. Shall be accountable for the successful completion of the project and shall bear responsibility for any issues or delays that may arise during the course of the project.
